question: Starting from the immunotherapy checkpoint genes PDCD1, CTLA4, and LAG3, run the closeness centrality algorithm. Which neighbouring genes show the greatest centrality (highest scores), and what ranks do they hold?
content: Seed genes (Closeness input): PDCD1, CTLA4, LAG3. Mapped UniProt IDs: Q15116, P16410, P18627. Drug associations (uniform closeness scores): Multiple drugs (e.g., DB09063, DB08895, DB01268, DB01254) all with score 0.4286 â€” indicating drug connections, not gene centrality results

question: Using the metabolic disease seeds INSR, GCK, and PPARG, apply the closeness centrality algorithm to the selected network. Which nodes emerge in the top 5 positions, and what are their closeness values?
content: Seed genes (Closeness input): INSR, GCK, PPARG. Mapped UniProt IDs: P06213, H2L099, Q4U3Q4. Top-5 ranked nodes (closeness = 1.0): DB09063, DB01268, DB00619, DB01259, DB04868. Observation: All top positions are drugs connected to INSR (P06213)
